chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

COURT ORDERS: 
22CF430:
Ct. 2 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take (<=$500)-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H- 2 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Restitution in the amount of $46.86 to be paid (plus 10% surcharge).

22CF431:

22CF658:

Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances, Restitution at $0 at this time, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge.

Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H- 5 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS:  6 Months MCJ, Concurrent- 85 Days Credit to be applied to conditional jail time. Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances, Restitution at $0 at this time, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances, Restitution at $0 at this time, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge.

Ct. 4 (Obstructing an Officer-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H- 2 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances, Restitution at $0 at this time, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 85 Days Credit.

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERS: $1,000.00 signature bond with first $150.00 in cash. Reside with mother (Chistine Janda).  Mother to co-sign bond.    No contact with victim(s): Any Kwik Trip Store in Marathon County.    Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
